subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to change dynamically (runtime) the classpath for a given test
msgSnippet: David, ... In fact, JUnit, run normally, does not modify the class loader mechanism.  You could indeed probably write a custom runner in JUnit 4 that does what
messageBody:
David,

On 9/26/07, David <achepati67@...> wrote:
> I guess jUnit modifies the class loader mechanism. It allows the
> user to change the start (setup() method) and the end of the process
> (teardown() method). Such are the open points on the process. If the
> class loader mechanism (something that happen at the begining) is
> modified, why not to let the user to configurate the classpath,
> because such modification shouldn't affect the intention of the test.

In fact, JUnit, run normally, does not modify the class loader
mechanism. You could indeed probably write a custom runner in JUnit 4
that does what you're looking for.

David Saff
